result.execSummary:
The defendant Mathew D. Gebhardt #644409 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt 2nd-Degree Intentional Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.05(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant was granted 458 days credit for time served

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  While in prison defendant should allow a portion of his inmate funds  be applied towards this restitution

Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Defendant shall seek employment and remain employed, if not employed he shall do job searches as directed by his agent.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request
Defendant shall undergo a mental Health Assessment and follow all recommendations and release all records to his agent.

The defendant shall have no contact with Robert Noggle, Jr. or his family or his residence of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

A Pre-Sentence Investigation is ordered.
